Package ulb.infof307.g02.gui.controller

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
ulb.infof307.g02.gui.controller.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
ControllerNavigator
Direct Known Subclasses:
AutochefController, ConnectionToAccountController, CreateAccountController, RecipeConfigureController, RecipeInfoController, RecipeListController, ScheduleConfigureController, ScheduleInfoController, ShoppingListConfigureController, ShoppingListInfoController, ShoppingListListController, ShoppingListStoreInfoController, StoreConfigureController, StoreInfoController, StoreListController
public abstract class Controller extends Object implements ControllerNavigator
Controller super-class, used to generalize some parts that all controller have in common. For example, loading the associated view, setting the stage and scene and display it. Also used to generalize navigation between controllers

    • goTo

      public <T extends Controller> void goTo(Supplier<T> nextController)
      Description copied from interface: ControllerNavigator
      Go to the next "view/controller" association, this one is used for controllers that does not require a model.
      Specified by:
      goTo in interface ControllerNavigator
      Type Parameters:
      T - we ensure that the constructor is associated to a controller ("supplies a controller")
      Parameters:
      nextController - : the constructor method of the controller associated to the view we want to display

    • goTo

      public <M extends SQLModel<M>, T extends Controller> void goTo(Function<M,T> nextController, M model)
      Description copied from interface: ControllerNavigator
      Go to the next "view/controller" association, this one is used when the controller require a model to display in the view. For example, when modifying a recipe
      Specified by:
      goTo in interface ControllerNavigator
      Type Parameters:
      M - we ensure that we receive a SQLModel, letting us use SQLModel methods such as getId() or getName()
      T - we ensure that the constructor is associated to a controller ("supplies a controller when given a SQLModel in argument")
      Parameters:
      nextController - : the constructor method of the controller associated to the view we want to display
      model - : the model needed by the controller to properly display information or execute
